es.csic.iiia.nsm.agent.language

Interface Taxonomy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TaxonomyOfNaturalNumbers, TaxonomyOfTerms

    public interface Taxonomy
    A taxonomy of terms in the domain of a predicate. A taxonomy of terms represents the generalisation relationships between the terms of a predicate's domain
    Author:
    "Javier Morales (jmorales@iiia.csic.es)"

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(java.lang.String term)
      Returns true if the taxonomy contains a given term, false otherwise
      int getGeneralisationLevel(java.lang.String term)
      Returns the level of generalisation of the given term in the taxonomy (i.e., the domain).
      java.lang.String getImmediateParentTerm(java.lang.String term)
      Returns the immediate parent of a given term
      java.lang.String getMostSpecifficGeneralisation(java.lang.String t1, java.lang.String t2)
      Returns the most specific term that generalises a pair of terms t1 and t2
      SetOfStrings getParentTerms(java.lang.String term)
      Returns a SetOfStrings that contains a set of all the terms that are more general than the given term in the taxonomy
      java.lang.String getPredicate()
      Returns the predicate to which the taxonomy corresponds
      boolean isTop(java.lang.String term)
      Returns true if the given term is in the top of the taxonomy.

        Returns the most specific term that generalises a pair of terms t1 and t2
        Parameters:

        t2 - the second term

      • getParentTerms

        SetOfStrings getParentTerms(java.lang.String term)
        Returns a SetOfStrings that contains a set of all the terms that are more general than the given term in the taxonomy
        Parameters:
        term - the term
        Returns:
        an object SetOfStrings that contains a set of sorted terms that are more general than the given term

      • getGeneralisationLevel

        int getGeneralisationLevel(java.lang.String term)
        Returns the level of generalisation of the given term in the taxonomy (i.e., the domain). The generalisation level indicates the position (i.e., height) of the term in the taxonomy. As an example, while a "leaf" term in the taxonomy has level 0, its immediate parent has level 1, and the parent of the parent has level 2
        Parameters:
        term - the term
        Returns:
        the level of generalisation of the given term in the taxonomy

      • isTop

        boolean isTop(java.lang.String term)
        Returns true if the given term is in the top of the taxonomy. In other words, it returns true if the term is the most general term in the taxonomy
        Parameters:
        term - the term
        Returns:
        true if the given term is in the top of the taxonomy

      • contains

        boolean contains(java.lang.String term)
        Returns true if the taxonomy contains a given term, false otherwise
        Parameters:
        term - the term
        Returns:
        true if the taxonomy contains the given term
